website_summaries.verdict: Although pricey, the results are extraordinary. Owners rave about the taste.
pros: Fast aeration for a smooth taste
cons: Tube is not long enough for larger bottles

customer_reviews.title: Loved this.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this.... for the first 2 months... then the batteries that came with the unit corroded within the unit. I have not heard back from the company... pretty expensive to only work for 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Katididrn

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but needs redesign where straw connects to head
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. I purchased this one to replace one we received as a gift. The original unit broke at the point where the straw connects with the head, soon after receiving it. I would give it 5 stars if that point wasn't easily broken plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My rating is bad because it broke after just a few uses
customer_reviews.text: My rating is bad because it broke after just a few uses. When it did work. It was amazing. The wine tasted so much better and it was quick and easy. It does take 6 AAA batteries which got me through about 12 bottles of wine. However, all of a sudden when I went to use it again, it just stopped working. I changed out the batteries and still nothing. I am outside the return or replace period so I am stuck with a $100 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product but broke after 39 days
customer_reviews.text: Love this product but broke after 39 days. Waiting to hear from company. If they do not warranty, I would STRONGLY run from this product! Breaks very easily! Update--Amazon refunded the money and Aervana offered a discount on a new one. I will try again. Still like the product, not sure about a 30 day warranty--seems l like it is not long enough but I will give it another round.
customer_reviews.author: frontallobedamage

customer_reviews.title: Love it—you’ve got one year!
customer_reviews.text: Hello Aervana- I purchased this awesome aerator for my husband for Christmas last year, Dec 2017. We are meticulous in caring for it exactly as you said to. By hand, no dishwasher, gently. We love it! However, it has recently stopped working. We’ve replaced the batteries several times with no response from the aerator. It simply does not turn on. For the price, I was hoping for some sort of recourse or warranty. I see from the manual there is a one year warranty only. Is there anything else that can be worked out? Or is it your expectation that for $90-ish dollars we should only expect the unit to work for one year? I’d love a response, either way.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Ripley

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest, if you've shopped around, you know you can get something very similar for A LOT less money. However, if you've read the reviews for those inexpensive aerators, you would have discovered that they are junk. My friend received one of these Aervana aerators as a gift several years ago. He just replaced the batteries for the first time and he uses it nearly every day! We liked his so much that we finally ordered one last August. It's been a year and we still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Miovech

customer_reviews.title: This works really well! I am super happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This works well and it looks really cool too. I am not sure how anyone can complain about it. It has a very sophisticated look to it. We have tried it many times now and really enjoyed it. The straw does not reach the last small glass worth of wine in the bottom of the bottle, but that's not a big deal. The Aervana rests easily on top of the wine bottle. Press the button on the top and it pours into your glass automatically and very smoothly. The wine tastes great! I am very happy with this purchase. It is so easy to use and a great conversation piece when serving guests. Everyone loves it!
customer_reviews.author: KinDallas

customer_reviews.title: Breaks only after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I still bought the product because the concept seemed great and some friends had one and they liked it. I didn't ask them how long they had it. Many reviews says amazing but breaks quickly. Unfortunately it's true. We used our about 7 times and then it broke. Wine leak out everywhere because it started to drain without us even pushing it down. We walked into the kitchen with a big puddle of wine. I plan to return the two I bought because although it's an amazing idea it does not last. After only a few uses it broke. Not worth the money for a few times usage.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea, hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: While the idea of this is great, the implementation isn't the best. It is a really neat idea, and guests love it. Unfortunately, it sticks up so much that it won't fit under any cabinets or anything. Cleaning it is a complete gripe, they HAVE to come up with an easier way to clean it. Maybe a really short straw (6" or so) and a mode that doesn't have to hook to a wine bottle so you can run water through it. Nobody I've tested it on can tell a difference in taste, but having a wine dispenser makes you look like a wine Pro
customer_reviews.author: Matt Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 6 months.... waiting on customer service now to fix
customer_reviews.text: I've used this without any problem (and LOVE IT) until yesterday, where the light will now not turn off and the motor runs continuously, but does not pump product. I have reached out to Aervana and they responded WITHIN one business day, and have asked me to ship to them to see if they can determine product. If they resolve to satisfaction, I will update back to 5 stars as this thing is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Fun and effective aerator.
customer_reviews.text: This aerator does make a difference with reds. Our group of wine friends love using this to dispense wines when we are doing tastings. The only issue we’ve found is it can’t get probably the last 10th of the bottle out- no big deal. Also, if you try to get that last little bit out, the head will sputter the wine and make a mess. Knowing this limitation, we still love it. Would happily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shuey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty expensive few glasses of wine
customer_reviews.text: this item has a plastic piece which goes into the wine bottle and it broke off before I had used it for a month! Pretty expensive few glasses of wine! I called the company and they would not do anything, and basically said too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It aerates as good as a $20 aerator.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a lot for the money. It does a great job at aerating and makes it convenient for pouring, however for $100, I thought maybe it would cook me something or at least sing me to sleep. Price not really justified, but a nice toy to add to a wine enthusiast's collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Near item, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice kitchen tool, but the inners corrode very easily. Our first one was never put in water but used outside in the summer in Georgia and I guess the humidity corroded the wires and it stopped working. The light turned on but no wine. We have bought three others for family and they live in Arizona and have had no issues. Really neat item, but poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jane Vester

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 3 of these, suddenly stopped working, poor design, turned out to be junk!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the first one as a gift, then bought 2 more for gifts. Wouldn't do it again! The first one has stopped working, NO USER ERROR! Only cleaned as the directions said to do so. We loved this product, that's why we bought 2 more. In fact many of our dinner guests bought them as well. We are very disappointed at the products performance in such a short time. Read some other reviews stating the same issue. I must agree with them, poor design and quality. Won't be purchasing any more. Now I will have to apologize to my guest and family members who also purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: Not measured pour. Wobbly on wine bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was going to use it so people wouldn't over pour during parties and I thought this would be a measured pour, it is not. You have to hold the button down the entire time. The casing isn't made very well, the rubber logo wrapped around the light was slipping on mine and kept getting bunched up. I also thought this would seal the wine. It does not. Overall, it "worked" it just wasn't a huge benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Rainchel

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: I AM IN LOVE!!!!! My husband and I actually put it to the test to see if it really does what it says..well it sure does!! I am telling you that when the wine is not aerated it has that small or strong zing of alcohol flavor, but when you use it, it literally takes that away since its aerated! Its phenomenal!!
customer_reviews.author: NelG

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This wine aerator can be better designed for how expensive it is. It works well, but the straw connection area breaks easily and cannot be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Sammie

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and when it worked I liked it. Unfortunately it just stopped working after about a month and I am stuck with a $100 straw. Would not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use with every bottle of red wine
customer_reviews.text: This is good aerator and is a talking piece as you pour your wine with friends. I've been using it often since I purchased and have yet to change the batteries. I know several friends that left my house with the intent to purchase their own.
customer_reviews.author: RaNae Seaton

customer_reviews.title: It seems like it is getting harder to push as time goes ...
customer_reviews.text: From the first day I got the unit it was somewhat hard to push the button down to expel the wine. It seems like it is getting harder to push as time goes on. Friend has one and there button is really easy to push down on. Wonder if I could get a replacement unit!
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Malek

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to say that I LOVE this but after only ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to say that I LOVE this but after only a few uses it is broken. The poor design of the stem tube attachment is the culprit here. The tube that carries the wine from the bottom of the bottle to the spout can no longer be attached.
customer_reviews.author: harry hauer buerger iii

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Got one for my daughter-in-law for Christmas. The second time she used it, the stem broke off. $100 well spent? I think not!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Fluker

customer_reviews.title: Product Does Take Care and Attention In Use
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product for 2 weeks now and have had no issues. I do see that you need to be extra careful in its use to make certain that now wine/water enters the upper chamber. This means no tilting of the unit even to a horizontal position. I can see where others would have problems here if care is not exercised. Perhaps the next designs will be more robust and prevent water damage to the unit regardless of some poor use habits. It does make a significant difference in the wine's taste.
customer_reviews.author: Wine Lover and Kitchen Gadget Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love It But Wish It Cost Less
customer_reviews.text: I have used this many times and love it. It does not fit on a vintage port bottle so I transferred the wine to a different bottle. After doing that, I was able to pour expensive port into small glasses without spillage. It helped keep consumption by vultures under control. I would buy this again assuming the first one has a long life. Wish it cost about $25 less though.
customer_reviews.author: NQ

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Handy
customer_reviews.text: What a handy wine serving tool. I love it!! So easy to use, and no need to allow red wine to breathe. It is ready to drink upon dispensing. The design is very attractive, and it compliments the other appliances in my kitchen. Plus no need for wine bottle stoppers, or trying to get the cork back in the bottle. Wine stays fresh. It is a wonderful gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Plld

customer_reviews.title: Great product with issues
customer_reviews.text: Great item only problem is that it was broken when I got it. As soon as I took the spout off the plastic end broke off. I suggest they change the spout end to stainless steel and it would be an amazing product. I returned it without problems and the 2nd one would not work at all. It was like it was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Oquendo

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for grannys!
customer_reviews.text: My granny loves her wine at night to help her sleep. She’s had a hard time lifting and pouring the bottles, until I found this gem. Absolutely worth every penny, the button is easy to push and it flows easily.
customer_reviews.author: Krystina Howell

customer_reviews.title: I have to admit this is far and away the best aerator I've used
customer_reviews.text: I have a few aerators from the plastic one that connects to the bottle to the a glass decanter. I have to admit this is far and away the best aerator I've used. You'd be surprised how nice it is not lifting the bottle up and just pressing a button. Worth every penny in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Aervana stood behind their product
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for a year and the stem broke. Aervana sent me a new one with no problem. I love the aerator and the ease of use. Love the product.

customer_reviews.title: Poor design

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Aerator works great, The two tubes for different size bottles are ...
customer_reviews.text: The Aerator works great, The two tubes for different size bottles are fine unless the bottom of the bottle has a bung hole, which leaves about an inch of wine in the bottle. It does a great job of filtering the wine. I would recommend this product to everyone. A very well made product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but great gift/wine gadget
customer_reviews.text: Received one as a gift and didn't really use it--but while planning a party, I had the idea to set up the wine table using a couple of these on 1.5 liter wine bottles. Although they don't serve the entire bottle, my guests were wowed! Great idea for parties. I wish Aervana would make the tubes longer for 1.5 liter size. Aerates well and dispenses fast. Pricey, but fun gift gadget. NOTE: I have since checked with Aervana and they do offer the magnum tubes for this. Worth getting! All my friends want one or two!!
customer_reviews.author: Gilmoregirl58

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife who absolutely loves a nice Pinot Noir. We’ve been using our aerator for now two months and while entertaining friends and family. Just recently, it stopped working all together and prior to it stopping the light would stay on and continued to shoot wine out. We’re going to purchase new batteries to see if that solves the problem. It’s expensive so we are hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband, (the most difficulty man to buy for) and he LOVES it! He says it works great. He only wishes it was a little shorter so it could fit on the countertop below the top cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: It really does a great job aerating wine. The taste difference is noticeable. However, it breaks easily. Mine broke where the tube attaches to the pump. Why would they make the most used part so fragile? Also, I see no easy way to repair or replace that part. Disappointed! 7/2/17 - I wrote them an email and they responded within 2 days that they would ship me a new one. I really appreciate the customer service!
customer_reviews.author: longhorn1990

customer_reviews.title: Great little aerator

I also love that the cleanest thing you just fill in empty wine bottle with warm water and rinse, and you'll always know you'll have an empty wine bottle around because come on you're drinking wine
customer_reviews.author: Nick Orsini

customer_reviews.title: Fatal design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This item has a fatal design flaw in that you cannot clean it. If you do run any water through it, it quits working because the electronic elements are not sealed to prevent water/liquid damage. If you can’t clean this, it isn’t for the serious wine connoisseur, imho. Too bad because it did an excellent job of aeration and kept a partial bottle well corked.
customer_reviews.author: JTH

customer_reviews.title: Taste via aeration is so much better
customer_reviews.text: Makes red wine taste so good.Like the difference between a chocolate bar and fine chocolate. Very smooth! Easy to use. Received as a gift and bought one for a gift.

As much as I love this, it is not worth $100 for it to end up breaking after a few months.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work

It appears it must get pushed to one side due to bottle design but ridgid thin tube broke? Can this be replaced?? Need help. Love product just upset it broke due to bottle design.

customer_reviews.title: It's a waist of money and customer service is horrible. The unit broke after 2 months of using ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this Aerator. It's a waist of money and customer service is horrible. The unit broke after 2 months of using it. I called Aervana's customer service and was told since it was a user error it could not be returned. User error???? It could be replaced for $50. I told the manager that I disagree with not replacing the items since we only used it for 2 months, but she would not budge. It's pretty embarrassing for what we spent to begin with, so to pay $50 on top of the $100 is ridiculous.
